author: Lincoln Journal Star
title: Special religious programs and events
text:
‘Last Blast with the Plymouth Brass' concert – 7 p.m. Sunday, Dec. 31, at First-Plymouth Church, 20th and D streets. Ring in the New Year with Abendmusik's last concert of 2023 with the Plymouth Brass and internationally acclaimed guest organist Alcée Chriss. A freewill offering will be taken to benefit the People’s City Mission. This free concert will be offered in person and also online at abendmusik.org .
Weekly men’s coffee and grief group meetings — 1 p.m. Tuesdays, register at Tabitha.org/Hospice/Bereavement , Scooters, 4500 S. 70th St.
Weekly women’s coffee and grief group meetings — 2 p.m. Wednesdays, register at Tabitha.org/Hospice/Bereavement , Scooters, 2901 S. 84th St.
People are also reading… One person hospitalized after home explosion in northeast Lincoln A couple of changes coming for downtown Lincoln restaurants Nebraska football's Dylan Raiola, Carter Nelson build connection in Polynesian Bowl win Nebraska native will compete in next season of 'The Bachelor' Four LPS principals announce their retirements; another changing position 2 more Nebraska football support staff members no longer with program Omaha Supernovas cut 4 players — including 2 with Nebraska ties 'It was scary' — Video shows man ramming skid loader into Lincoln police cruiser 2 Nebraska football support staff members no longer with program On popular podcast, Nancy Grace gets the facts wrong about Tyler Goodrich case Two Lincoln Public Schools officials announce their retirements Superintendent says LPS can handle more snow days if necessary How to watch Dylan Raiola and Carter Nelson in the Polynesian Bowl Nebraska Gov. Jim Pillen wants 'government out of the way,' he says in filibuster-delayed speech Another round of snow, cold headed for Lincoln Concert by Terri Jo Jenkins and her combo — 11:30 a.m.-1 p.m. Friday, Jan. 5, in the Activity Center at First Lutheran Church, 1551 S. 70th St.
Each week, religion notes will feature special events, programs and worship services. Submit information for consideration to mschwaninger@journalstar.com with RELIGION NOTE in the subject line.
